xmlns="http://www.sitemaps.org/schemas/sitemap/0.9" xmlns="http://www.google.com/schemas/sitemap-image/1.1" xmlns:video="http://www.google.com/schemas/sitemap-video/1.1">
https://tmrev.io/movie/312540-Dorothy Dandridge: Singing at Her Best 2022-11-27
https://image.tmdb.org/t/p/w500/jheh2S5Fp0Amd75PCKR9OvmCU1M.jpg Legendary entertainer Dorothy Dandridge -- the first black woman to be nominated for a Best Actress Oscar (for director Otto Preminger's Carmen Jones in 1954) -- shows off her vocal talents in this collection of vintage performances. An amalgamation of movie trailers and feature-film clips, this fitting musical tribute includes the songs "Blow Out the Candles," "My Heart Belongs to Daddy" and "Swing for My Supper." Dorothy Dandridge: Singing at Her Best
